page.title: 06Desford Parish Council
page.content: Desford Parish Council has ten members, eight representing Desford Ward and two the Bufton Ward, which comprises two small hamlets north and east of Desford. Seven members of the present council were elected in 1983. Since then, one member was disqualified through failure to attend meetings, and was replaced by co-option. Two others resigned and were replaced, one by co-option and the other through a by-election requested by parishioners. The present composition of the council is seven men and three women. Desford is linked with Peckleton Parish to form part of a Borough Council with 2 members, and additionally with Barwell as a County Council division with one member. Both Borough councillors & the County councillor are also members of Desford Parish Council.
